website_summaries.verdict: If you're planning on working with glass pieces of varying thickness, this is the cutter to consider first.
pros: Can handle 2mm to 19mm glass thicknesses.Self-oiling mechanism in brass body
cons: Barrel awkward to hold under pressure

customer_reviews.title: Good but needs instructions
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Comfortable. Be sure to unscrew the ball cap a bit or the oil won’t be released onto the blade. Sorely needs instructions, but doesn’t include them. I did better breaking off the scored glass with pliers than by tapping the glass with the ball on the end of the cutter. I underdtand why the blade head is spring loaded (to prevent oil from leaking) but it makes it harder to use because you have to press down while cutting or your blade will pop up and jump over the edge of your ruler guide.
customer_reviews.author: J Denny

customer_reviews.title: After a few cut it got dulled. Did not ...
customer_reviews.text: After a few cut it got dulled. Did not have smooth cut. I had a lot of trouble cutting curved glass. But it’s finally done!
customer_reviews.author: P. Hoang

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Not thrilled. Oil doesn't want to come out, so it must be dipped in lubricant before using. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Denise J. Dube

customer_reviews.title: Rockin' little glass cutter.
customer_reviews.text: This little glass cutter rocks! I had never cut glass before and I used this cutter to cut my large bathroom mirror into two smaller mirrors that I am now framing. It was easy and impressive when the mirror cracked and separated right along the cut line. Almost like magic!
customer_reviews.author: lawrence rupp

customer_reviews.title: hard to control
customer_reviews.text: I Hate this glass cutter! I have a hard time keeping it from sliding around while I am trying to just cut a straight line. I would not buy it again; in fact, I'm going to buy a different one :(
customer_reviews.author: Erik J Lichtenberger

customer_reviews.title: He was not disappointed with the performance
customer_reviews.text: I gave this as a gift to my brother. He had been attempting to cut a piece of glass. He was not disappointed with the performance.
customer_reviews.author: Billy Kidd

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: Useless. Was trying to cut 1/8” mirror and never cracked straight on multiple attempts
customer_reviews.author: Stas Bey

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Couldn't find replacement heads anywhere. Anyone know where?
customer_reviews.author: rich camlin

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Thank you for a great product at a great price!
customer_reviews.author: Karen Cain-Smith

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: took a few tries, but now that I have practiced it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: first time i ever cut 1/4 glass and it worked great
customer_reviews.author: ernie carroll

customer_reviews.title: Very good tool
customer_reviews.text: I am new in glass cutting, but with this tool I learned quickly how to cut glass. I use it on my project almost every day and happy with the quality it provides.
customer_reviews.author: Marina K.

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Nothing really to note. A solid glass cutter that will do the job. I bought this because I wanted to add a glass bed to my 3D printer. I needed a rectangle with the corners cut off in order to access the bed leveling screws, and Lowe's would cut the rectangle to size but would not do the corner cuts. This tool worked perfectly. The cuts that I got were cleaner than the guy at Lowe's was able to get. Next time I will do all of the cutting myself.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: This is the best glass cutter I've ever used although I did change ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the best glass cutter I've ever used although I did change the cutterhead to an existing head that I already had I'm a commercial blazer been in the business for 25 years I love this body of this cutter I am so happy with it I've never been more excited about cutting glass It's like a piece of jewelry I love it
customer_reviews.author: Fox glass orl.

customer_reviews.title: Great glass cutter
customer_reviews.text: Great glass cutter. Easy to use and has a good amount of weight for tapping with the ball at the rear. I managed to do the complex curves in the image with this cutter, with little to no trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked great
customer_reviews.text: I've never cut glass before, so I wanted a tool that was highly recommended, and this one did not disappoint. I watched a couple of youtube videos before trying it, and viola! My first cut went smoothly and quickly. After scoring, I put a thin long piece of flat wood under the scored seam and applied a minimal amount of pressure on both sides, and that did the trick. I did oil the tip, but I'm not sure you need it.
customer_reviews.author: newigwam

customer_reviews.title: Great Glass Cutter for Beginners and Above
customer_reviews.text: My wife is taking a couple stained glass classes and said she would like her own tools. This was better quality than what she was using in class and loved the glass tapper on the end. Works very well and no complaints after 8 or 9 pieces, so think this is a keeper for her growing collection. She liked the control of it for delicate work, but went to her pistol grip for repetitive and straight cuts. Self oiler seems to work well and no issues keeping the blade coated or leaking as she is using it.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Kollman

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: Finally the glass breaks properly! A friend said to make the score, flip the glass and use the ball to tap along the score on the other side. I was so frustrated with my old cutter that I was thinking how I could do my hobby mosaics without cutting and now I am moving right along. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: love2read

customer_reviews.title: Scorch but mirror did not break cleanly.
customer_reviews.text: I was able to scorch the mirror, and you can clearly see the line. I placed a 1 X 4 under the mirror where the scorch mark was made and applied even pressure. The mirror did not snap.
customer_reviews.author: steven Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: I live this tool. Totally recommend it!
customer_reviews.text: This is really the way to go when you're cutting glass Here's a small tutorial if you'd like: Citytinker.com/2016/07/tips-on-how-to-cut-glass-to-size.html
customer_reviews.author: Ana

customer_reviews.title: Hard to hold while applying adequate glass scoring pressure.
customer_reviews.text: Hard to hold while applying adequate glass scoring pressure. A pistol grip would have been better.
customer_reviews.author: HonestReview

customer_reviews.title: Seems like it works good and quality seems ok
customer_reviews.text: I'm a beginner, so I really didn't know how to use it properly. Seems like it works good and quality seems ok.
customer_reviews.author: Darlene Calhoun

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice large size for my big hands and worked very well. oil compartment seals well so no oily hands.
customer_reviews.author: Divertom

customer_reviews.title: Lives in my pocket, next to my soldering iron.
customer_reviews.text: I carry it everyday, because who doesn't need a glass cutter?
customer_reviews.author: Jim Z.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Cuts really good. I like that it has a oil reservoir.
customer_reviews.author: J. Gibson

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I like this glass cutter. I love my Cutters Mate more.
customer_reviews.author: Sherri Jones

customer_reviews.title: I did try to cut the glasses soon after received ...
customer_reviews.text: I did try to cut the glasses soon after received the cutter. I was able to cut the glasses as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a good quality glass cutter but I'm not a fan. It's too fat for me to get a good grip on it and the head swivels. I'm new to stained glass making but these two factors didn't do me any favors. I'll be ordering a different one.
customer_reviews.author: AHost

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Cuts glass, took some practice but got the house b done.
customer_reviews.author: Michele004

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Like that is fairly light and scores the glass very easy
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great cutter!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! Cut a bunch of glass with this so far and am very satisfied. Didn't realize it didn't come with cutting oil though, but that's my fault for not reading the description.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: He has done some amazing work since getting this cutter
customer_reviews.text: This little jewel of a tool has totally change my grandsons skills. He has done some amazing work since getting this cutter. He now has something to use to create his visions. His latest one an Orca ROCKS. Would by this again in a heartbeat!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa R.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Did what I wanted it to do. Will use again and again.
customer_reviews.author: Kent C. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: It cuts nicely but the handle is very large. Hard for a small hand.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: waste of money☹️
customer_reviews.text: Didn't cut glass and it came with instructions... waste of money☹️
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Heavy Duty Metal Handle Oil Feed Glass Cutter.
feature_bullets: Professional Carbide Tungsten carbide Alloy Handle Oil Feed Glass Cutter, 2mm-19mm.
Durable brass body lets you monitor the cutting fluid level
Glass cutter is self oiling when pressure is applied An automatic oil dispensing system keeps the wheel lubricated every time you cut.
Cutting wheel is made of durable carbide Plastic hand grip is easy to hold and reduces wrist fatigue. Lightweight and compact design Glass Cutter Tool is easy to carry.
